pulltitle: Bug 823628 - Add revert buttons to go back to previous tree states
pullsbody:
This adds "revert" buttons to the revisions shown on individual tree pages. When clicked, it prompts the user whether they really want to do it.
If the user agrees, the script resets the tree status form on the page and fills in the information from the selected tree status.

It doesn't automatically submit the newly reverted status, the user has a chance to edit it further before manually submitting the change.

It also only adds the button for treestatus changes listed in the "recent changes" section. The full history in the /logs view is unchanged. Additionally, this doesn't add the revert button for MOTD changes.
pull_commit_message: Bug 823628 - Add revert buttons to go back to previous tree states rs=emorley

pulltitle: Bug 823627 - Increase the size of the 'reason' textbox to display more of the reason without scrolling
pullsbody:
This increases the width of the reason input fields to 70 characters (same as MOTD). 

It also adds a bit of padding to the field so it's not pushed right up against the New State line.

It also puts a max-width onto the reason column in the history tables, though it looks a bit funny if the reason is a long string without any breaks (it overflows into the tags column).
pull_commit_message: Bug 823627 - Increase the size of the 'reason' textbox to display more of the reason without scrolling

pullsbody: Each individual tree's page in treestatus should link back to the main list of trees at the root of treestatus.mozilla.org, so sheriffs can jump back to get to other trees.
pull_commit_message:
Bug 980573 - Link back to the main TreeStatus page

Each individual tree's page in treestatus should link back to the main list of trees at the root of treestatus.mozilla.org, so sheriffs can jump back to get to other trees.

pulltitle: Automatically transform "bug XXXXXX" into a b.m.o link in JSON output
pullsbody: I'm sure I remember seeing edmorley wish for this, though I don't remember where! "bug XXXXXX" will only be transformed if it does not appear to be already part of a link: I'm using a fairly simple heuristic of looking for a closing tag following the bug number, but I think this should be sufficient for our purposes. This only affects the JSON output. If "bug XXXXXX" was expanded in all cases - e.g. by sticking the relevant code into Status.get_tree(s) - then if we pre-fill the fields per issue 22, on submission the sheriff may find the field unexpectedly truncated as the form submission would then include the full link text (76 characters). The only alternative would be to strip out any Bugzilla links from the reason and motd fields prior to being stored in the DB - that seemed needlessly invasive.
pull_commit_message: Automatically transform "bug XXXXXX" into a b.m.o link in JSON output

pulltitle: Fix for issue 24: Add "Message Of The Day" field for tree-specific information unrelated to openings/closures
pullsbody:
This pull request follows the approach in https://github.com/catlee/treestatus/issues/24#issuecomment-7972880 

Thus, if accepted, to avoid breakage, it requires the production database schema to be manually changed,  and this code deployed immediately afterwards. (SQLAlchemy will throw up integrity errors if the schema is updated without the code being changed, and vice versa)
pull_commit_message: Add "Message of the day" field to trees

pullsbody:
JSON responses are used by other applications and therefore need to be
updated as soon as a change is made on the UI, and therefore shouldn't
be cached.
pull_commit_message:
Don't cache json responses

JSON responses are used by other applications and therefore need to be
updated as soon as a change is made on the UI, and therefore shouldn't
be cached.

pull_commit_message: Don't trigger delete requests when pressing ENTER elsewhere on the form
